text: Guangzhou Baiyunshan (Simplified Chinese: 广州白云山) was a Chinese football club, located in Zhongshan, Guangdong, China. The club was founded in the 1998 and promoted to the second tier of Chinese football league at the end of 1998 season. The club was disbanded at the end of 2000 season after failing to promote to the second tier. They gained 5 points in the 1999 season (1 win, 2 draws and 19 defeats) and relegated to third tier league. The only match they win was in the last round of the season, they beat Jiangsu Gige 1–0.全国足球甲B联赛降下帷幕 广州白云山客场胜江苏加佳 ==Results== {| class="wikitable" style="text- align: Center;" !Season !1998 !1999 !2000 |- |Division |3 |2 |3 |- |Position |bgcolor=gold|1 |12 |3 |} ==Honours== * Chinese Yi League: 1998 ==International players== * Eduardo Arriola * Patrick Katalay ==References== Category:Defunct football clubs in Guangdong Category:Association football clubs established in 1998 Category:Association football clubs disestablished in 2000 Category:1998 establishments in China Category:2000 disestablishments in China
title: Guangzhou Baiyunshan F.C.
